SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

services.latex
Class Renderer

java.lang.Object
  services.latex.Renderer

public class Renderer
extends java.lang.Object

This class allows for rendering of LaTeX documents from within Java. It can be used also for the coversion of LaTeX documents into EPS files (only the first page is output).

The external software that has to be available is:

  • latex
  • dvips (found in the same folder as latex)
  • GhostScript (preferrably version 8+)

To use the renderer: 

 Renderer r=Renderer.getRenderer("path to latex","path to ghostscript");
 Image i=r.renderString("$\\alpha$");

Version:
2.0
Author:
Lenko Grigorov, Michael Wood

Constructor Detail

Renderer

private Renderer(java.io.File latexPath,
                 java.io.File gsPath)
Construct a new object which will use the provided paths to latex and GhostScript.

Parameters:
latexPath - the directory where the latex and dvips binaries are located (e.g., "c:\texmf\miktex\bin")
gsPath - the location of the GhostScript command-line engine (e.g., "c:\gs\gs8.14\bin\gswin32c.exe" on Windows)
Method Detail

getRenderer

public static Renderer getRenderer(java.io.File latexPath,
                                   java.io.File gsPath)
Create a new Renderer which will use the provided paths when calling LaTeX, dvips and GhostScript.

Parameters:
latexPath - the path to latex and dvips (e.g., "c:\texmf\miktex\bin")
gsPath - the path to gswin32c (e.g., "c:\gs\gs8.14\bin")
Returns:
a new Renderer which will use the provided paths when calling LaTeX, dvips and GhostScript.

renderStringToFile

public java.awt.image.BufferedImage renderStringToFile(java.lang.String s,
                                                       java.io.File f)
                                                throws java.io.IOException,
                                                       LatexRenderException
Render a piece of LaTeX code into a PNG image file.

Parameters:
s - LaTeX code (the code goes in the body of a LaTeX document)
f - file where to save image. If the file exists, its content will be overwritten.
Returns:
the image which was saved in the file
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there was a problem with the IO
LatexRenderException - if there was a problem while rendering the LaTeX code
See Also:

renderTempFile

protected java.awt.image.BufferedImage renderTempFile(java.io.File latexFile)
                                               throws java.io.IOException,
                                                      LatexRenderException
Render the first page of the LaTeX document contained in a temporary file. This method is called by all other rendering methods. The method removes all temporary files (including the file in the parameter) after finishing the rendering.

Parameters:
latexFile - file containing the LaTeX document
Returns:
image with the rendition
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there was a problem with the IO
LatexRenderException - if there was a problem while rendering the LaTeX code

latex2PNG

protected java.awt.image.BufferedImage latex2PNG(java.io.File latexFile,
                                                 int dpi)
                                          throws java.io.IOException,
                                                 LatexRenderException
Renders the first page of the LaTeX document contained in a file into an uncropped image.

Parameters:
latexFile - file containing the LaTeX document
dpi - the resolution to be used for the redering (in dots per inch)
Returns:
uncropped image of the first page of the LaTeX document
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there was a problem with the IO
LatexRenderException - if there was a problem while rendering the LaTeX code
See Also:
renderTempFile(File), tempLatex2EPS(File, File)

removeTempFiles

private void removeTempFiles(java.io.File latexFile)
Deletes all files which are located in the same directory as the parameter and which have the same name (only the extension can differ).

For example, if the parameter is the file "c:\temp\ides0013.tex", then the files "c:\temp\ides0013.*" will be deleted.

Parameters:
latexFile - file whose name and location will be used to determine which files to delete
See Also:
renderTempFile(File), tempLatex2EPS(File, File)

execute

private void execute(Renderer.Executor ex)
              throws LatexRenderException
Execute a call to an external program as per an Renderer.Executor object, using a timeout of TIMEOUT milliseconds.

Parameters:
ex - the Renderer.Executor with the call that has to be executed
Throws:
LatexRenderException - if the call timed out or if the call didn't succeed
See Also:
Renderer.Executor

findBoundingBox

private java.awt.Rectangle findBoundingBox(java.awt.image.Raster r)
Finds the bounding box of an image with a single band (grayscale). The bounding box is defined as the smallest rectangle such that all pixels outside the rectangle are white.

Parameters:
r - raster of the image
Returns:
the bounding box of the image
See Also:
renderTempFile(File), tempLatex2EPS(File, File)

latex2EPS

public void latex2EPS(java.lang.String doc,
                      java.io.File target)
               throws java.io.IOException,
                      LatexRenderException
Convert the first page of a LaTeX document into an EPS file.

Parameters:
doc - LaTeX document
target - file where to save the EPS. If the file exists, its content will be overwritten.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there was a problem with the IO
LatexRenderException - if there was a problem while rendering the LaTeX code
See Also:
latex2EPS(File, File), latex2EPS(InputStream, File)

tempLatex2EPS

protected void tempLatex2EPS(java.io.File latexFile,
                             java.io.File target)
                      throws java.io.IOException,
                             LatexRenderException
Convert the first page of a LaTeX document contained in a temporary file into an EPS file. This method is called by all other methods that convert into EPS. The method removes all temporary files (including the file in the parameter) after finishing conversion.

Parameters:
latexFile - file containing the LaTeX document
target - file where to save the EPS. If the file exists, its content will be overwritten.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there was a problem with the IO
LatexRenderException - if there was a problem while rendering the LaTeX code
See Also:
latex2EPS(File, File), latex2EPS(InputStream, File), latex2EPS(String, File)

fixBoundingBox

protected void fixBoundingBox(java.awt.Rectangle boundary,
                              java.io.File source,
                              java.io.File target)
                       throws java.io.IOException
Fixes the BoundingBox comment in EPS files so it reflects the true boundary of the graphic. Some tools (notably dvips) may not always generate a correct BoundingBox comment.

Parameters:
boundary - the correct boundary of the graphic
source - EPS file which needs to be fixed. Cannot be the same as the target file.
target - file where the corrected EPS will be written. Cannot be the same as the source file.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there was a problem with the IO
See Also:
tempLatex2EPS(File, File)
